Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Punjab Food Authority labeled the image as "fake" and stated that there is no evidence of the coronavirus spreading among goats in Pakistan.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that Pakistan has issued a warning against eating goat meat due to the coronavirus outbreak, when there is no evidence to support this.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not seem to falter at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence to support the warning against eating goat meat in Pakistan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the coronavirus is spreading among goats in Pakistan, which is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the Punjab Food Authority and the doctor from Pakistan's National Institute of Health, who both state that there is no evidence of the virus spreading among goats in Pakistan.
